001package com.deploygate.sdk;
002
003import android.app.Application;
004import android.content.BroadcastReceiver;
005import android.content.ComponentName;
006import android.content.Context;
007import android.content.Intent;
008import android.content.IntentFilter;
009import android.content.ServiceConnection;
010import android.os.Build;
011import android.os.Bundle;
012import android.os.Handler;
013import android.os.IBinder;
014import android.os.RemoteException;
015import android.text.TextUtils;
016import android.util.Log;
017
018import com.deploygate.sdk.internal.Logger;
019import com.deploygate.service.DeployGateEvent;
020import com.deploygate.service.IDeployGateSdkService;
021import com.deploygate.service.IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback;
022
023import java.util.HashSet;
024import java.util.LinkedList;
025import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
026
027/**
028 * This is DeployGate SDK library. Import this library to the application
029 * package and call {@link #install(Application)} on the onCreate() of
030 * application class to enable crash reporting and application launch
031 * notification.
032 * <p>
033 * In order to get working Remote LogCat feature, you also have to add
034 * <code>&lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_LOGS" /&gt;</code>
035 * in AndroidManifest.xml of your application.
036 * </p>
037 *
038 * @author tnj
039 */
040public class DeployGate {
041    private static final String TAG = "DeployGate";
042
043    private static final String ACTION_DEPLOYGATE_STARTED = "com.deploygate.action.ServiceStarted";
044    private static final String DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE = "com.deploygate";
045
046    private static DeployGate sInstance;
047
048    private final Context mApplicationContext;
049    private final DeployGateClient mDeployGateClient;
050    private final HostApp mHostApp;
051    private final Handler mHandler;
052    private final ILogcatInstructionSerializer mLogcatInstructionSerializer;
053    private final CustomLogInstructionSerializer mCustomLogInstructionSerializer;
054    private final HashSet<DeployGateCallback> mCallbacks;
055    private final String mExpectedAuthor;
056    private String mAuthor;
057
058    private CountDownLatch mInitializedLatch;
059    private boolean mIsDeployGateAvailable;
060
061    private boolean mAppIsManaged;
062    private boolean mAppIsAuthorized;
063    private boolean mAppIsStopRequested;
064    private String mLoginUsername;
065    private String mDistributionUserName;
066    private int mCurrentRevision;
067    private String mDistributionId;
068    private String mDistributionTitle;
069
070    private boolean mAppUpdateAvailable;
071    private int mAppUpdateRevision;
072    private String mAppUpdateVersionName;
073    private int mAppUpdateVersionCode;
074    private String mAppUpdateMessage;
075
076    private IDeployGateSdkService mRemoteService;
077
078    private final IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback mRemoteCallback = new IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback.Stub() {
079
080        public void onEvent(
081                String action,
082                Bundle extras
083        ) throws RemoteException {
084            if (TextUtils.isEmpty(action)) {
085                return;
086            }
087
088            if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_INIT.equals(action)) {
089                onInitialized(extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_MANAGED, false), extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_AUTHORIZED, false), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGIN_USERNAME), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_DISTRIBUTION_USER_NAME), extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_STOP_REQUESTED, false), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_AUTHOR), extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_REVISION, 0), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_DISTRIBUTION_ID), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_DISTRIBUTION_TITLE));
090            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_UPDATE_AVAILABLE.equals(action)) {
091                onUpdateArrived(extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SERIAL), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VERSION_NAME), extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VERSION_CODE), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SERIAL_MESSAGE));
092            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_ONESHOT_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
093                onOneshotLogcat();
094            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_ENABLE_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
095                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.STREAMED_LOGCAT)) {
096                    String sessionKey = extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGCAT_STREAM_SESSION_KEY);
097
098                    if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sessionKey)) {
099                        Logger.w("%s is missing in the extra", DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGCAT_STREAM_SESSION_KEY);
100                        return;
101                    }
102
103                    onEnableStreamedLogcat(sessionKey);
104                } else {
105                    Logger.w("streamed logcat is not supported");
106                }
107            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_DISABLE_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
108                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.STREAMED_LOGCAT)) {
109                    onDisableStreamedLogcat();
110                } else {
111                    Logger.w("streamed logcat is not supported");
112                }
113            }
114        }
115
116        private void onInitialized(
117                final boolean isManaged,
118                final boolean isAuthorized,
119                final String loginUsername,
120                final String distributionUserName,
121                final boolean isStopped,
122                final String author,
123                int currentRevision,
124                String distributionId,
125                String distributionTitle
126        ) throws RemoteException {
127            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service initialized");
128            mAppIsManaged = isManaged;
129            mAppIsAuthorized = isAuthorized;
130            mAppIsStopRequested = isStopped;
131            mLoginUsername = loginUsername;
132            mDistributionUserName = distributionUserName;
133            mAuthor = author;
134            mCurrentRevision = currentRevision;
135            mDistributionId = distributionId;
136            mDistributionTitle = distributionTitle;
137
138            mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
139                @Override
140                public void run() {
141                    for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
142                        callback.onInitialized(true);
143                        callback.onStatusChanged(isManaged, isAuthorized, loginUsername, isStopped);
144                    }
145                }
146            });
147
148            mIsDeployGateAvailable = true;
149
150            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.setDisabled(false);
151            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.connect(mRemoteService);
152            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.setEnabled(true);
153            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.connect(mRemoteService);
154
155            mInitializedLatch.countDown();
156        }
157
158        private void onUpdateArrived(
159                final int serial,
160                final String versionName,
161                final int versionCode,
162                final String message
163        ) throws RemoteException {
164            mAppUpdateAvailable = true;
165            mAppUpdateRevision = serial;
166            mAppUpdateVersionName = versionName;
167            mAppUpdateVersionCode = versionCode;
168            mAppUpdateMessage = message;
169
170            mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
171                @Override
172                public void run() {
173                    for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
174                        callback.onUpdateAvailable(serial, versionName, versionCode);
175                    }
176                }
177            });
178        }
179    };
180
181    private void requestOneshotLogcat() {
182        onOneshotLogcat();
183    }
184
185    private void onOneshotLogcat() {
186        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.requestOneshotLogcat();
187    }
188
189    private void onEnableStreamedLogcat(String streamSessionKey) {
190        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(streamSessionKey)) {
191            Logger.w("sdk-origin streamed logcat requests are forbidden");
192            return;
193        }
194
195        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.requestStreamedLogcat(streamSessionKey);
196    }
197
198    private void onDisableStreamedLogcat() {
199        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.stopStream();
200    }
201
202    void callbackDeployGateUnavailable() {
203        mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
204            @Override
205            public void run() {
206                for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
207                    callback.onInitialized(false);
208                    callback.onStatusChanged(false, false, null, false);
209                }
210            }
211        });
212    }
213
214
215    /**
216     * Do not instantiate directly. Call {@link #install(Application)} on your
217     * {@link Application#onCreate()} instead.
218     */
219    private DeployGate(
220            Context applicationContext,
221            String author,
222            DeployGateCallback callback,
223            CustomLogConfiguration customLogConfiguration,
224            HostApp hostApp
225    ) {
226        mApplicationContext = applicationContext;
227        mDeployGateClient = new DeployGateClient(applicationContext, DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE);
228        mHostApp = hostApp;
229        mHandler = new Handler();
230        mLogcatInstructionSerializer = mHostApp.canUseLogcat ? new LogcatInstructionSerializer(mHostApp.packageName) : ILogcatInstructionSerializer.NULL_INSTANCE;
231        mCustomLogInstructionSerializer = new CustomLogInstructionSerializer(mHostApp.packageName, customLogConfiguration);
232        mCallbacks = new HashSet<DeployGateCallback>();
233        mExpectedAuthor = author;
234
235        prepareBroadcastReceiver();
236
237        if (callback != null) {
238            mCallbacks.add(callback);
239        }
240
241        mInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
242        initService(true);
243    }
244
245    private boolean initService(boolean isBoot) {
246        if (mDeployGateClient.isInstalled) {
247            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate installation detected. Initializing.");
248            bindToService(isBoot);
249            return true;
250        } else {
251            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate is not available on this device.");
252            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.setDisabled(true);
253            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.setEnabled(false);
254            mInitializedLatch.countDown();
255            mIsDeployGateAvailable = false;
256            callbackDeployGateUnavailable();
257            return false;
258        }
259    }
260
261    private void prepareBroadcastReceiver() {
262        IntentFilter filter = new IntentFilter(ACTION_DEPLOYGATE_STARTED);
263        BroadcastReceiver receiver = new BroadcastReceiver() {
264            @Override
265            public void onReceive(
266                    Context context,
267                    Intent intent
268            ) {
269                if (intent == null) {
270                    return;
271                }
272                if (mDeployGateClient.isInstalled) {
273                    bindToService(false);
274                }
275            }
276        };
277
278        if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU) {
279            mApplicationContext.registerReceiver(receiver, filter, Context.RECEIVER_EXPORTED);
280        } else {
281            mApplicationContext.registerReceiver(receiver, filter);
282        }
283    }
284
285    private void bindToService(final boolean isBoot) {
286        Intent service = new Intent(IDeployGateSdkService.class.getName());
287        service.setPackage(DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE);
288        mApplicationContext.bindService(service, new ServiceConnection() {
289            public void onServiceConnected(
290                    ComponentName name,
291                    IBinder service
292            ) {
293                Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service connected");
294                mRemoteService = IDeployGateSdkService.Stub.asInterface(service);
295                requestServiceInit(isBoot);
296            }
297
298            @Override
299            public void onServiceDisconnected(ComponentName name) {
300                Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service disconneced");
301                mRemoteService = null;
302                mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.disconnect();
303                mLogcatInstructionSerializer.disconnect();
304            }
305        }, Context.BIND_AUTO_CREATE);
306    }
307
308    private void requestServiceInit(final boolean isBoot) {
309        Bundle args = new Bundle();
310        args.putBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_BOOT, isBoot);
311        args.putBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CAN_LOGCAT, mHostApp.canUseLogcat);
312        args.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXPECTED_AUTHOR, mExpectedAuthor);
313        args.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SDK_VERSION, mHostApp.sdkVersion);
314        try {
315            mRemoteService.init(mRemoteCallback, mHostApp.packageName, args);
316        } catch (RemoteException e) {
317            Log.w(TAG, "DeployGate service failed to be initialized.");
318        }
319    }
320
321    private void invokeAction(
322            String action,
323            Bundle extras
324    ) {
325        if (mRemoteService == null) {
326            return;
327        }
328        try {
329            mRemoteService.sendEvent(mHostApp.packageName, action, extras);
330        } catch (RemoteException e) {
331            Log.w(TAG, "failed to invoke " + action + " action: " + e.getMessage());
332        }
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Clear the initiated DeployGate instance.
337     * <p>
338     * This method is only for testing so breaking changes would may happen.
339     */
340    static void clear() {
341        sInstance = null;
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
346     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()} once.
347     * <p>
348     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
349     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
350     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
351     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
352     * instead.
353     * </p>
354     * <p>
355     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
356     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
357     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
358     * redistribution via DeployGate.
359     * </p>
360     *
361     * @param app
362     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
363     *
364     * @throws IllegalStateException
365     *         if this called twice
366     * @since r1
367     */
368    public static void install(Application app) {
369        install(app, (String) null);
370    }
371
372    /**
373     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
374     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()} once.
375     * <p>
376     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
377     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
378     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
379     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
380     * instead.
381     * </p>
382     *
383     * @param app
384     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
385     * @param author
386     *         author username of this app.
387     *
388     * @throws IllegalStateException
389     *         if this called twice
390     * @since r2
391     */
392    public static void install(
393            Application app,
394            String author
395    ) {
396        install(app, author, null);
397    }
398
399    /**
400     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
401     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
402     * once.
403     * <p>
404     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
405     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
406     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
407     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
408     * instead.
409     * </p>
410     * <p>
411     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
412     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
413     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
414     * redistribution via DeployGate.
415     * </p>
416     *
417     * @param app
418     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
419     * @param callback
420     *         Callback interface to listen events.
421     *
422     * @throws IllegalStateException
423     *         if this called twice
424     * @since r1
425     */
426    public static void install(
427            Application app,
428            DeployGateCallback callback
429    ) {
430        install(app, null, callback);
431    }
432
433    /**
434     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
435     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
436     * once.
437     * <p>
438     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
439     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
440     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
441     * redistribution via DeployGate.
442     * </p>
443     *
444     * @param app
445     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
446     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
447     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
448     *         the release build, set this true.
449     *
450     * @throws IllegalStateException
451     *         if this called twice
452     * @since r4.2
453     */
454    public static void install(
455            Application app,
456            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
457    ) {
458        install(app, null, null, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild);
459    }
460
461    /**
462     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
463     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
464     * once.
465     * <p>
466     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
467     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
468     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
469     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
470     * instead.
471     * </p>
472     *
473     * @param app
474     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
475     * @param author
476     *         author username of this app.
477     * @param callback
478     *         Callback interface to listen events.
479     *
480     * @throws IllegalStateException
481     *         if this called twice
482     * @since r2
483     */
484    public static void install(
485            Application app,
486            String author,
487            DeployGateCallback callback
488    ) {
489        install(app, author, callback, false);
490    }
491
492    /**
493     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
494     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
495     * once.
496     * <p>
497     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
498     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
499     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
500     * redistribution via DeployGate.
501     * </p>
502     *
503     * @param app
504     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
505     * @param callback
506     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
507     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
508     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
509     *         the release build, set this true.
510     *
511     * @throws IllegalStateException
512     *         if this called twice
513     * @since r1
514     */
515    public static void install(
516            Application app,
517            DeployGateCallback callback,
518            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
519    ) {
520        install(app, null, callback, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild);
521    }
522
523    /**
524     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
525     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
526     * once.
527     *
528     * @param app
529     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
530     * @param author
531     *         author username of this app. Can be null.
532     * @param callback
533     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
534     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
535     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
536     *         the release build, set this true.
537     *
538     * @since r2
539     */
540    public static void install(
541            Application app,
542            String author,
543            DeployGateCallback callback,
544            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
545    ) {
546        install(app, author, callback, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild, new CustomLogConfiguration.Builder().build());
547    }
548
549    /**
550     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
551     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
552     * once.
553     *
554     * @param app
555     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
556     * @param author
557     *         author username of this app. Can be null.
558     * @param callback
559     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
560     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
561     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
562     *         the release build, set this true.
563     * @param customLogConfiguration
564     *         set a configuration for custom logging
565     *
566     * @since 4.4.0
567     */
568    public static void install(
569            Application app,
570            String author,
571            DeployGateCallback callback,
572            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild,
573            CustomLogConfiguration customLogConfiguration
574    ) {
575        if (sInstance != null) {
576            Log.w(TAG, "DeployGate.install was already called. Ignoring.");
577            return;
578        }
579
580        HostApp hostApp = new HostApp(app.getApplicationContext());
581
582        if (!forceApplyOnReleaseBuild && !hostApp.debuggable) {
583            return;
584        }
585
586        Thread.setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler(new DeployGateUncaughtExceptionHandler(Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()));
587        sInstance = new DeployGate(app.getApplicationContext(), author, callback, customLogConfiguration, hostApp);
588    }
589
590    /**
591     * Request refreshing cached session values (e.g., isAuthorized, etc.) to
592     * the DeployGate service. Nothing happens if this called before
593     * {@link #install(Application)} or when refreshing is already in progress.
594     * Note that after calling this, {@link #isInitialized()} will changed to
595     * false immediately and any call to <code>is*()</code> will be blocked until
596     * refreshing get finished.
597     *
598     * @since r1
599     */
600    public static void refresh() {
601        if (sInstance != null) {
602            sInstance.refreshInternal();
603        }
604    }
605
606    private void refreshInternal() {
607        if (mInitializedLatch.getCount() == 0) {
608            mInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
609            if (mRemoteService == null) {
610                initService(false);
611            } else {
612                requestServiceInit(false);
613            }
614        }
615    }
616
617    /**
618     * Register a DeployGate event callback listener. Don't forget to call
619     * {@link #unregisterCallback(DeployGateCallback)} when the callback is no
620     * longer needed (e.g., on destroying an activity.) If the listener has
621     * already in the callback list, just ignored.
622     *
623     * @param listener
624     *         callback listener
625     * @param refreshImmediately
626     *         if you want to receive current states, set this
627     *         true.
628     *
629     * @since r1
630     */
631    public static void registerCallback(
632            DeployGateCallback listener,
633            boolean refreshImmediately
634    ) {
635        if (sInstance == null) {
636            return;
637        }
638        if (listener == null) {
639            return;
640        }
641
642        sInstance.registerCallbackInternal(listener, refreshImmediately);
643    }
644
645    private void registerCallbackInternal(
646            DeployGateCallback listener,
647            boolean callbackImmediately
648    ) {
649        mCallbacks.add(listener);
650        if (callbackImmediately) {
651            refresh();
652        }
653    }
654
655    /**
656     * Unregister a callback listener. If the listener was not registered, just
657     * ignored.
658     *
659     * @param listener
660     *         callback listener to be removed
661     *
662     * @since r1
663     */
664    public static void unregisterCallback(DeployGateCallback listener) {
665        if (sInstance == null) {
666            return;
667        }
668        if (listener == null) {
669            return;
670        }
671
672        sInstance.mCallbacks.remove(listener);
673    }
674
675    /**
676     * Get whether SDK is completed its intialization process and ready after
677     * {@link #install(Application)}. This call will never blocked.
678     *
679     * @return true if SDK is ready. false otherwise. If no install() called
680     * ever, this always returns false.
681     *
682     * @since r1
683     */
684    public static boolean isInitialized() {
685        if (sInstance != null) {
686            return sInstance.mInitializedLatch.getCount() == 0;
687        }
688        return false;
689    }
690
691    /**
692     * Get whether DeployGate client service is available on this device.
693     * <p>
694     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
695     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
696     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
697     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
698     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
699     * </p>
700     *
701     * @return true if valid DeployGate client is available. false otherwise. If
702     * no install() called ever, this always returns false.
703     *
704     * @since r1
705     */
706    public static boolean isDeployGateAvaliable() {
707        if (sInstance != null) {
708            waitForInitialized();
709            return sInstance.mIsDeployGateAvailable;
710        }
711        return false;
712    }
713
714    /**
715     * Get whether this application and its package is known and managed under
716     * the DeployGate.
717     * <p>
718     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
719     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
720     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
721     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
722     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
723     * </p>
724     *
725     * @return true if DeployGate knows and manages this package. false
726     * otherwise. If no install() called ever, this always returns
727     * false.
728     *
729     * @since r1
730     */
731    public static boolean isManaged() {
732        if (sInstance != null) {
733            waitForInitialized();
734            return sInstance.mAppIsManaged;
735        }
736        return false;
737    }
738
739    /**
740     * Get whether current DeployGate user has this application in his/her
741     * available list. You may want to check this value on initialization
742     * process of the main activity if you want to limit user of this
743     * application to only who you explicitly allowed.
744     * <p>
745     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
746     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
747     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
748     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
749     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
750     * </p>
751     *
752     * @return true if current DeployGate user has available list which contains
753     * this application. false otherwise. If no install() called ever,
754     * this always returns false.
755     *
756     * @since r1
757     */
758    public static boolean isAuthorized() {
759        if (sInstance != null) {
760            waitForInitialized();
761            return sInstance.mAppIsAuthorized;
762        }
763        return false;
764    }
765
766    /**
767     * Get current DeployGate username. This function only available when
768     * {@link #isAuthorized()} is true.
769     * <p>
770     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
771     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
772     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
773     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
774     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
775     * </p>
776     *
777     * @return Current user of DeployGate. May be null.
778     *
779     * @since r1
780     */
781    public static String getLoginUsername() {
782        if (sInstance != null) {
783            waitForInitialized();
784            return sInstance.mLoginUsername;
785        }
786        return null;
787    }

789    /**
790     * Get current app's author (e.g., User or Organzation) name on DeployGate. You
791     * may use this value to check the app was distributed by yourself or
792     * someone else.
793     * <p>
794     * <b>Tip:</b> If you want to prevent distributing your app by someone else
795     * on the DeployGate, consider using {@link #install(Application, String)}.
796     * </p>
797     * <p>
798     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
799     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
800     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
801     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
802     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
803     * </p>
804     *
805     * @return Owner User or Organization of current app. May be null.
806     *
807     * @since r2
808     */
809    public static String getAuthorUsername() {
810        if (sInstance != null) {
811            waitForInitialized();
812            return sInstance.mAuthor;
813        }
814        return null;
815    }

817    /**
818     * Record ERROR level event on DeployGate. Log message will immediately send
819     * to the server so you may see it on your dashboard. Nothing happen when
820     * DeployGate is not available, i.e. {@link #isAuthorized()} is not true.
821     *
822     * @param message
823     *         Message body to be send. May be truncated if it's too
824     *         long.
825     *
826     * @since r1
827     */
828    public static void logError(String message) {
829        if (sInstance != null) {
830            sInstance.sendLog("error", message);
831        }
832    }

903    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
904    private/* public */ static boolean isStopRequested() {
905        if (sInstance != null) {
906            waitForInitialized();
907            return sInstance.mAppIsStopRequested;
908        }
909        return false;
910    }
911
912    private static void waitForInitialized() {
913        try {
914            sInstance.mInitializedLatch.await();
915        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
916            Log.w(TAG, "Interrupted while waiting initialization");
917        }
918    }
919
920    static DeployGate getInstance() {
921        return sInstance;
922    }
923
924    void sendCrashReport(/* non-null */ Throwable ex) {
925        if (mRemoteService == null) {
926            return;
927        }
928
929        Bundle extras = new Bundle();
930        try {
931            if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.SERIALIZED_EXCEPTION)) {
932                Throwable rootCause = getRootCause(ex);
933                String msg = rootCause.getMessage();
934                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_ROOT_CAUSE_CLASSNAME, rootCause.getClass().getName());
935                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_ROOT_CAUSE_MESSAGE, msg != null ? msg : "");
936                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_STACKTRACES, Log.getStackTraceString(ex));
937            } else {
938                extras.putSerializable(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION, ex);
939            }
940
941            mRemoteService.sendEvent(mHostApp.packageName, DeployGateEvent.ACTION_SEND_CRASH_REPORT, extras);
942        } catch (RemoteException e) {
943            Log.w(TAG, "failed to send crash report: " + e.getMessage());
944        }
945    }
946
947    /* non-null */
948    private static Throwable getRootCause(/* non-null */ Throwable ex) {
949        Throwable cause = ex;
950        LinkedList<Throwable> throwables = new LinkedList<>();
951
952        while (cause != null && !throwables.contains(cause)) {
953            throwables.add(cause);
954            cause = cause.getCause();
955        }
956
957        return throwables.getLast();
958    }
959
960    void sendLog(
961            String type,
962            String body
963    ) {
964        mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.requestSendingLog(new CustomLog(type, body));
965    }
966
967    static boolean isFeatureSupported(Compatibility compatibility) {
968        if (sInstance == null) {
969            return false;
970        }
971
972        return sInstance.mDeployGateClient.isSupported(compatibility);
973    }
974
975    /**
976     * Capture current LogCat and send it. This call will work asynchronously.
977     * Capturing LogCat requires <code>android.permission.READ_LOGS</code> is
978     * declared on your app AndroidManifest.xml, or your app is running on
979     * Android 4.1 or higher. If LogCat is not available, this function simply
980     * does nothing.
981     *
982     * @since r3
983     */
984    public static void requestLogCat() {
985        if (sInstance != null) {
986            sInstance.requestOneshotLogcat();
987        }
988    }

991    /**
992     * Returns the revision of the app on DeployGate.
993     * The revision number is automatically incremented integer value every time you upload a build to DeployGate,
994     * so you can identify the build explicitly.
995     * <p>
996     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns 0.
997     *
998     * @return revision number of the app, or 0 if DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
999     *
1000     * @since r4
1001     */
1002    public static int getCurrentRevision() {
1003        if (sInstance != null) {
1004            return sInstance.mCurrentRevision;
1005        }
1006        return 0;
1007    }
1008
1009    /**
1010     * Returns the URL of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1011     * <p>
1012     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1013     *
1014     * @return URL of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1015     *
1016     * @since r4
1017     */
1018    public static String getDistributionUrl() {
1019        if (sInstance == null) {
1020            return null;
1021        }
1022
1023        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionId)) {
1024            return null;
1025        }
1026
1027        return "https://deploygate.com/distributions/" + sInstance.mDistributionId;
1028    }
1029
1030    /**
1031     * Returns the ID (40 digits hex string appears in URL) of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1032     * <p>
1033     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1034     *
1035     * @return ID of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1036     *
1037     * @since r4
1038     */
1039    public static String getDistributionId() {
1040        if (sInstance == null) {
1041            return null;
1042        }
1043
1044        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionId)) {
1045            return null;
1046        }
1047
1048        return sInstance.mDistributionId;
1049    }
1050
1051    /**
1052     * Returns the title of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1053     * <p>
1054     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1055     *
1056     * @return Title of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1057     *
1058     * @since r4
1059     */
1060    public static String getDistributionTitle() {
1061        if (sInstance == null) {
1062            return null;
1063        }
1064
1065        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionTitle)) {
1066            return null;
1067        }
1068
1069        return sInstance.mDistributionTitle;
1070    }

1074     *
1075     * @return Version code of DeployGate in integer. Please refer to {@link DeployGate#getDeployGateLongVersionCode()}
1076     */
1077    @Deprecated

1079        if (sInstance == null) {
1080            return 0;
1081        }
1082
1083        return (int) sInstance.mDeployGateClient.versionCode;
1084    }

1101    /**
1102     * Check whether there's update of the app.
1103     * You can get detailed information via {@link #getUpdateRevision()}, {@link #getUpdateVersionCode()}, {@link #getUpdateVersionName()}, and {@link #getUpdateMessage()}.
1104     *
1105     * @return true if there's an update, false otherwise.
1106     *
1107     * @since r4.2
1108     */
1109    public static boolean hasUpdate() {
1110        if (sInstance == null) {
1111            return false;
1112        }
1113
1114        return sInstance.mAppUpdateAvailable;
1115    }

1121     *
1122     * @since r4.2
1123     */
1124    public static int getUpdateRevision() {
1125        if (sInstance == null) {
1126            return 0;
1127        }
1128
1129        return sInstance.mAppUpdateRevision;
1130    }

1137     * @since r4.2
1138     */

1141            return 0;
1142        }

1144        return sInstance.mAppUpdateVersionCode;

1160    }

1162    /**
1163     * Returns the message attached to the build.
1164     * If the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is not null,}
1165     * this method returns Release Note that was entered when you published a new version on the page.
1166     * Otherwise this method returns the message that was entered when you upload a new build to DeployGate.
1167     * <p>
1168     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1169     *
1170     * @return The message attached to the build
1171     *
1172     * @since r4
1173     */
1174    public static String getUpdateMessage() {
1175        if (sInstance == null || !isFeatureSupported(Compatibility.UPDATE_MESSAGE_OF_BUILD)) {
1176            return null;
1177        }
1178
1179        return sInstance.mAppUpdateMessage;
1180    }
1181
1182    /**
1183     * Start the installation of the latest version of the app if available. No effects if there's no update.
1184     * <p>
1185     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1186     *
1187     * @since r4
1188     */
1189    public static void installUpdate() {
1190        if (sInstance == null) {
1191            return;
1192        }
1193
1194        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_INSTALL_UPDATE, null);
1195    }
1196
1197    /**
1198     * Open comments screen for the distribution of the app installed.
1199     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1200     * <p>
1201     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1202     *
1203     * @since r4
1204     */
1205    public static void openComments() {
1206        if (sInstance == null || sInstance.mDistributionId == null) {
1207            return;
1208        }
1209
1210        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_OPEN_COMMENTS, null);
1211    }
1212
1213    /**
1214     * Open comment composer screen for the distribution of the app installed.
1215     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1216     * <p>
1217     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1218     *
1219     * @since r4
1220     */
1221    public static void composeComment() {
1222        composeComment(null);
1223    }
1224
1225    /**
1226     * Open comment composer screen for the distribution of the app installed with pre filled string.
1227     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1228     * <p>
1229     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1230     *
1231     * @param defaultComment
1232     *         Default comment set to the editor
1233     *
1234     * @since r4
1235     */
1236    public static void composeComment(String defaultComment) {
1237        if (sInstance == null || sInstance.mDistributionId == null) {
1238            return;
1239        }
1240
1241        Bundle extras = new Bundle();
1242        extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_COMMENT, defaultComment);
1243        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_COMPOSE_COMMENT, extras);
1244    }
1245
1246    /**
1247     * Get current user's name on Distribution Page. Default name is randomly generated string (like "[abcd1234]").
1248     * <p>
1249     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function returns null.
1250     *
1251     * @return User's display name on DeployGate. May be null.
1252     *
1253     * @since r4
1254     */
1255    public static String getDistributionUserName() {
1256        if (sInstance == null) {
1257            return null;
1258        }
1259
1260        return sInstance.mDistributionUserName;
1261    }
